intro: Ochlandra, commonly known as the pandanus or screw pine, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Pandanaceae. These plants are characterized by their unique, often spirally arranged leaves and distinctive, often fragrant, flowers. Ochlandra species are typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in coastal and wetland environments. They are known for their robust, woody stems and are often used in traditional crafts and as ornamental plants. The genus includes several species, some of which are adapted to saline soils and can tolerate periodic flooding.
